intro: Erythranthe lacerata, commonly known as the fringed rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in open areas with full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually narrow and sometimes lobed, while its flowers are small, bright yellow, and have a distinctive fringed appearance. Erythranthe lacerata is generally hardy and drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to arid environments.
